intro: Pericalymma floridum, commonly known as the Florida pericalymma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring moist to aquatic habitats. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating, aiding in water retention.
